words.source: Proper noun, name of Jacob's firstborn son. All translations: Reuben
Construct phrase: preposition בְּ + noun בְּכוֹר (firstborn) + possessive suffix י (my). KJV, ESV, NASB: 'my firstborn'
2nd masculine singular pronoun. Functions as copula in Hebrew nominal clause. All translations: 'you are'
Noun כֹּחַ (strength, might) + possessive suffix י (my). KJV, ESV, NASB: 'my might'
Conjunction וְ + noun רֵאשִׁית (beginning, first fruits). KJV, ESV, NASB: 'and the beginning'
Noun אוֹן (strength, vigor) + possessive suffix י (my). Construct relationship with preceding רֵאשִׁית. KJV, ESV, NASB: 'of my strength'
Noun יֶתֶר (excess, preeminence, superiority). Accusative of specification. KJV: 'excellency'; ESV, NASB: 'preeminent'
Noun שְׂאֵת (dignity, elevation, honor). Construct with יֶתֶר. KJV: 'of dignity'; ESV, NASB: 'in dignity'
Conjunction וְ + noun יֶתֶר (excess, preeminence). Parallel structure to position 7. KJV: 'and excellency'; ESV, NASB: 'and preeminent'
Noun עֹז (strength, power, might). Construct with second יֶתֶר. KJV: 'of power'; ESV, NASB: 'in power'
